title: Authors and Citation
text: Alice Byers. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Byers (2023). sgplot: Graphic Styles Colours Scottish Government Plots. https://github.com/DataScienceScotland/sgplot, https://DataScienceScotland.github.io/sgplot.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sgplot: Graphic Styles and Colours for Scottish Government Plots},   author = {Alice Byers},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/DataScienceScotland/sgplot, https://DataScienceScotland.github.io/sgplot}, }

what: Graphic Styles and Colours for Scottish Government Plots
title: Graphic Styles and Colours for Scottish Government Plots
text: sgplot R package creating accessible plots Scottish Government. Currently, functions available styling ggplot2 plots. information package functions can found https://DataScienceScotland.github.io/sgplot.

title: Graphic Styles and Colours for Scottish Government Plots
text: install sgplot, package remotes required. package can installed directly GitHub : Network security settings may prevent remotes::install_github() working. case, sgplot can installed downloading zip repository running following code (replacing section marked <>, including arrows , location downloaded zip):
code: remotes::install_github(   "DataScienceScotland/sgplot",   upgrade = "never" ) remotes::install_local(   "<FILEPATH OF ZIPPED FILE>/sgplot-main.zip",   upgrade = "never" )

title: Graphic Styles and Colours for Scottish Government Plots
text: sgplot package can loaded using library() function: Help files function package can found References page package website. Alternatively, type ?function_name RStudio console. example: easiest way use sgplot adding use_sgplot() beginning R script, Rmarkdown document Shiny app code. function set number defaults ggplot2 geoms, use sgplot colour palettes use theme_sg().

what: Continuous colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_continuous_sg
title: Continuous colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_continuous_sg
text: Continuous colour scales Scottish Government plots

title: Continuous colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_continuous_sg
code: scale_colour_continuous_sg(   palette = "sequential",   reverse = FALSE,   na_colour = "grey50",   guide = "colourbar",   ... )

title: Continuous colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_continuous_sg
text: palette Name palette use `sg_colour_palettes`; e.g. main, sequential, focus. Default value 'sequential'. reverse Boolean value indicate whether palette reversed. na_colour Colour set missing values. guide name function used create guide. Default "colourbar". ... Additional arguments passed scale type.

title: Continuous colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_continuous_sg
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt, colour = cyl)) +   geom_point() +   scale_colour_continuous_sg()

what: Discrete colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_discrete_sg
title: Discrete colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_discrete_sg
text: Discrete colour scales Scottish Government plots

title: Discrete colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_discrete_sg
Discrete colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_discrete_sg
text: palette Name palette use `sg_colour_palettes`; e.g. main, sequential, focus. Default value 'main'. reverse Boolean value indicate whether palette reversed. ... Additional arguments passed scale type.

title: Discrete colour scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_colour_discrete_sg
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt, colour = as.factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   scale_colour_discrete_sg()

text: palette Name palette use `sg_colour_palettes`; e.g. main, sequential, focus. Default value 'sequential'. reverse Boolean value indicate whether palette reversed. na_colour Colour set missing values. guide name function used create guide. Default "colourbar". ... Additional arguments passed scale type.

title: Continuous colour fill scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_fill_continuous_sg
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(faithfuld, aes(x = waiting, y = eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_raster() +   scale_fill_continuous_sg()

text: palette Name palette use `sg_colour_palettes`; e.g. main, sequential, focus. Default value 'main'. reverse Boolean value indicate whether palette reversed. ... Additional arguments passed scale type.

title: Discrete colour fill scales for Scottish Government plots — scale_fill_discrete_sg
code: library(ggplot2)  d <- subset(mpg, manufacturer == "ford")  ggplot(d, aes(x = model, fill = class)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_discrete_sg()

Return function to use Scottish Government colour palette — sg_palette
text: palette Name palette `sg_colour_palettes` reverse Boolean value indicate whether palette reversed colour_names Boolean value indicate whether colour names included

what: Scottish Government theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_sg
title: Scottish Government theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_sg
text: ggplot2 theme Scottish Government plots.

title: Scottish Government theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_sg
code: theme_sg(   base_size = 12,   base_line_size = base_size/22,   base_rect_size = base_size/22,   grid = c("y", "x", "xy", "none") )

title: Scottish Government theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_sg
text: base_size base font size, given pts. base_line_size base size line elements. base_rect_size base size rect elements. grid 'x', 'y', 'xy' 'none' determine grid lines drawn. Defaults 'y'.

title: Scottish Government theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_sg
code: library(ggplot2)  p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class)) + geom_bar()  p  p + theme_sg()

title: Use sgplot defaults. — use_sgplot
text: Set sgplot theme, colour palette geom aesthetic defaults ggplot2 charts.

title: Use sgplot defaults. — use_sgplot
Use sgplot defaults. — use_sgplot
text: default_grid 'x', 'y', 'xy' 'none' determine grid lines drawn. Defaults 'y'. default_colour Default colour/fill geoms. Default value 'dark-blue' sgplot::sg_colour_values.

title: Use sgplot defaults. — use_sgplot
code: library(ggplot2)  d <- subset(mpg, manufacturer == "ford")  ggplot(d, aes(x = model)) + geom_bar()  ggplot(d, aes(x = model, fill = class)) + geom_bar()   use_sgplot() #> ℹ Default ggplot2 theme set to `theme_sg`. #> ℹ Default colours set. #> ℹ Default geom aesthetics set.  ggplot(d, aes(x = model)) + geom_bar()  ggplot(d, aes(x = model, fill = class)) + geom_bar()
